comment.author: 40878011@N07
comment._content: The building to the right is the Chancery, on the E. side of the cathedral close. This front dates from c.1480-90 (although the top floor windows and their associated gables are 19th century alterations), but there are older parts behind. Nikolaus Pevsner and John Harris, The Buildings of England: Lincolnshire, 2nd edn., rev. Nicholas Antram (London: Penguin, 1989), p.492
